column4: When partitioning, I get the error "There are uncorrected errors... if you continue this partition will not be used". Not really that helpful... have no idea of the errors it's talking about. Any idea on what I could do?
(problem happens when formatting and making a mount point for the / partition)
did you specifc a file system?
dunno, I always just used the bin from sun's site
Alrighty; will do. Just a shame that the repositories there are included...
I noticed. That's what I did first; don't know what to do with the .deb (I'm new to Debian systems).
This time j2re (I already had the RPM in a folder), but I'm sure there's other stuff I'll need to install
I'm referring to gentoo though with that comment...compiling qt took forever :/
Ah, right. I'm sure it would. ;)
and it acheieves that goal well :)
yeah :p I need to switch it to plain-text I suppose
when texting more than one line you can get a preview of how it will come out, if you like...
